intro: Gilia nuttallii var. montana, commonly known as mountain gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds.
